history.title: History of Jharkhand
history.description: Jharkhand has a rich historical tapestry, marked by ancient tribal civilizations, freedom movements, and the eventual formation of the state.

items.title: Formation of State
items.description: Jharkhand was officially formed on 15th November 2000 after being carved out of Bihar.

items.title: Tribal Resistance
items.description: Revolts like the Santhal rebellion and leaders like Birsa Munda symbolize tribal resistance against British colonialism.

items.title: British Colonial Era
items.description: The British exploited Jharkhand’s natural resources, causing socio-economic and cultural impacts.

items.title: Freedom Movement
items.description: Jharkhand played a role in India’s struggle for freedom through regional uprisings and brave tribal martyrs.

items.title: Post-Independence Movements
items.description: Movements led by Adivasi organizations fought for statehood based on distinct identity and resource rights.

items.title: Cultural Identity
items.description: Despite challenges, Jharkhand retained its tribal identity and eventually earned recognition as a separate state.

culture.title: Culture of Jharkhand
culture.description: The cultural landscape of Jharkhand is a vibrant mix of tribal traditions, folk music, colorful dances, and deep spiritual beliefs.

items.title: Chhau Dance
items.description: A traditional masked dance incorporating martial arts, mostly performed in eastern Jharkhand.

items.title: Santhali Music
items.description: Music played during festivals and daily life, using instruments like tamak and tumdak.

items.title: Tribal Art & Paintings
items.description: Tribal communities express themselves through paintings using natural colors and motifs.

items.title: Folk Literature
items.description: Oral traditions include legends, proverbs, and folk tales passed down generations.

items.title: Traditional Attire
items.description: Tribal wear includes handwoven sarees and jewelry made from beads and metals.

items.title: Festive Gatherings
items.description: Communities come together during festivals to dance, sing, and feast, showcasing unity and joy.

festivals.title: Festivals of Jharkhand
festivals.description: Jharkhand celebrates a variety of tribal and local festivals that highlight its deep spiritual connection with nature and community life.

items.title: Sarhul
items.description: Marks the arrival of spring; worship of the Sal tree and nature spirits.

items.title: Karma
items.description: Celebrated by tribal communities for prosperity and fertility, involving music and tree worship.

items.title: Tusu Parab
items.description: Harvest festival mainly celebrated by Kurmi and Munda communities.

items.title: Sohrai
items.description: Post-harvest cattle festival celebrated with wall painting and rituals.

items.title: Jitia
items.description: Observed by mothers for the well-being of their children.

items.title: Makar Sankranti
items.description: Pan-Indian festival also celebrated widely in Jharkhand with local customs.
